verses.verse: To the chief Musician, <WH5329> even to Jeduthun, <WH3038> A Psalm <WH4210> of David. <WH1732> I said, <WH559> I will take heed <WH8104> to my ways, <WH1870> that I sin not <WH4480> <WH2398> with my tongue: <WH3956> I will keep <WH8104> my mouth <WH6310> with a bridle, <WH4269> while <WH5750> the wicked <WH7563> is before <WH5048> me.
I was dumb <WH481> with silence, <WH1747> I held my peace, <WH2814> even from good; <WH4480> <WH2896> and my sorrow <WH3511> was stirred. <WH5916>
My heart <WH3820> was hot <WH2552> within <WH7130> me, while I was musing <WH1901> the fire <WH784> burned: <WH1197> then spoke <WH1696> I with my tongue, <WH3956>

LORD, <WH3068> make me to know <WH3045> mine end, <WH7093> and the measure <WH4060> of my days, <WH3117> what <WH4100> it <WH1931> is; that I may know <WH3045> how <WH4100> frail <WH2310> I <WH589> am.

Behold, <WH2009> thou hast made <WH5414> my days <WH3117> as a handbreadth; <WH2947> and mine age <WH2465> is as nothing <WH369> before <WH5048> thee: verily <WH389> every <WH3605> man <WH120> at his best state <WH5324> is altogether <WH3605> vanity. <WH1892> Selah. <WH5542>

Surely <WH389> every man <WH376> walketh <WH1980> in a vain show: <WH6754> surely <WH389> they are disquieted <WH1993> in vain: <WH1892> he heapeth up <WH6651> riches, and knoweth <WH3045> not <WH3808> who <WH4310> shall gather <WH622> them.
And now, <WH6258> Lord, <WH136> what <WH4100> wait <WH6960> I for? my hope <WH8431> is in thee.
Deliver <WH5337> me from all <WH4480> <WH3605> my transgressions: <WH6588> make <WH7760> me not <WH408> the reproach <WH2781> of the foolish. <WH5036>
I was dumb, <WH481> I opened <WH6605> not <WH3808> my mouth; <WH6310> because <WH3588> thou <WH859> didst <WH6213> it.
Remove <WH5493> thy stroke <WH5061> away from <WH4480> <WH5921> me: I <WH589> am consumed <WH3615> by the blow <WH4480> <WH8409> of thine hand. <WH3027>

When thou with rebukes <WH8433> dost correct <WH3256> man <WH376> for <WH5921> iniquity, <WH5771> thou makest his beauty <WH2530> to consume away <WH4529> like a moth: <WH6211> surely <WH389> every <WH3605> man <WH120> is vanity. <WH1892> Selah. <WH5542>

Hear <WH8085> my prayer, <WH8605> O LORD, <WH3068> and give ear <WH238> unto my cry; <WH7775> hold not thy peace <WH2790> <WH408> at <WH413> my tears: <WH1832> for <WH3588> I <WH595> am a stranger <WH1616> with <WH5973> thee, and a sojourner, <WH8453> as all <WH3605> my fathers <WH1> were.
O spare <WH8159> <WH4480> me, that I may recover strength, <WH1082> before <WH2962> I go <WH1980> hence, and be no <WH369> more.
